com.mygdx.game

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    Assessment 2
    Version:
    Assessment 2 An executable version of the game can be found at: https://jm179796.github.io/SEPR/DRTN-Assessment2.jar Our website is: https://jm179796.github.io/SEPR/
    Author:
    Duck Related Team Name in Big Massive Letters

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GameEngine.State
      Encodes possible play-states These are not to be confused with the game-state (which is directly linked to the renderer)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentPlayerID
      Holds the numeric getID of the player who's currently active in the game
      private Drawer drawer
      Object providing QOL drawing functions to simplify visual construction and rendering tasks
      private com.badlogic.gdx.Game game
      Stores current game-state, enabling transitions between screens and external QOL drawing functions
      private GameScreen gameScreen
      The game's engine only ever runs while the main in-game interface is showing, so it was designed to manipulate elements (both visual and logical in nature) on that screen It therefore requires access to the public methods in the GameScreen class, so instantiation in this class is a necessity
      private Market market
      Holds all of the data and the functions of the game's market Also comes bundled with a visual interface which can be rendered on to the game's screen
      private int phase
      Holds the number of the phase that the game is currently in Varies between 1 and 5
      private Player[] players
      Stores data pertaining to the game's active players For more information, check the "Player" class
      private java.lang.Integer roboticonIDCounter
      An integer signifying the ID of the next roboticon to be created
      private Tile selectedTile
      Holds the data pertaining to the currently-selected tile
      private GameEngine.State state
      Variable dictating whether the game is running or paused at any given moment
      private boolean tileAcquired
      Defines whether or not a tile has been acquired in the current phase of the game
      private Tile[] tiles
      Array holding the tiles to be laid over the map Note that the tiles' visuals are encoded by the image declared and stored in the GameScreen class (and not here)
      private GameTimer timer
      Timer used to dictate the pace and flow of the game This has a visual interface which will be displayed in the top-left corner of the game-screen

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEngine(com.badlogic.gdx.Game game, GameScreen gameScreen)
      Constructs the game's engine.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private boolean checkGameEnd()
      Returns a value that's true if all tiles have been claimed, and false otherwise
      void claimTile()
      Claims the last tile to have been selected on the main GameScreen for the active player This grants them the ability to plant a Roboticon on it and yield resources from it for themselves Specifically registers the selected tile under the object holding the active player's data, re-colours its border for owner identification purposes and moves the game on to the next player/phase
      Player currentPlayer()
      Returns the data pertaining to the player who is active at the time when this is called
      int currentPlayerID()
      Returns the ID of the player who is active at the time when this is called
      void deployRoboticon()
      Deploys a Roboticon on the last tile to have been selected Draws a Roboticon from the active player's Roboticon count and assigns it to the tile in question
      Market market()
      Returns all of the data pertaining to the game's market, which is declared and managed by the engine
      void nextPhase()
      Advances the game's progress upon call Acts as a state machine of sorts, moving the game from one phase to another depending on what phase it is currently at when this method if called.
      void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game and opens the pause-menu (which is just a sub-stage in the GameScreen class) Specifically pauses the game's timer and marks the engine's internal play-state to [State.PAUSE]
      int phase()
      Return's the game's phase as a number between (or possibly one of) 1 and 5
      Player[] players()
      Returns all of the data pertaining to the array of players managed by the game's engine Unless the game's architecture changes radically, this should only ever return two Player objects
      void resumeGame()
      Resumes the game and re-opens the primary in-game inteface Specifically increments the in-game timer by 1 second, restarts it and marks the engine's internal play-state to [State.PAUSE] Note that the timer is incremented by 1 second to circumvent a bug that causes it to lose 1 second whenever it's restarted
      Tile selectedTile()
      Returns the data pertaining to the last Tile that was selected by a player
      GameEngine.State state()
      Return's the game's current play-state, which can either be [State.RUN] or [State.PAUSE] This is not to be confused with the game-state (which is directly linked to the renderer)
      private void switchCurrentPlayer()
      Sets the current player to be that which isn't active whenever this is called Updates the in-game interface to reflect the statistics and the identity of the player now controlling it
      Tile[] tiles()
      Collectively returns every Tile managed by the engine in array
      GameTimer timer()
      Returns the GameTimer declared and managed by the engine
      void updateCurrentPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
      Updates the data pertaining to the game's current player This is used by the Market class to process item transactions
      void upgradeRoboticon(int resource)
      Function for upgrading a particular level of the roboticon stored on the last tile to have been selected

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        private com.badlogic.gdx.Game game
        Stores current game-state, enabling transitions between screens and external QOL drawing functions

      • gameScreen

        private GameScreen gameScreen
        The game's engine only ever runs while the main in-game interface is showing, so it was designed to manipulate elements (both visual and logical in nature) on that screen It therefore requires access to the public methods in the GameScreen class, so instantiation in this class is a necessity

      • players

        private Player[] players
        Stores data pertaining to the game's active players For more information, check the "Player" class

        Holds the numeric getID of the player who's currently active in the game

        Holds the number of the phase that the game is currently in Varies between 1 and 5

      • tileAcquired

        private boolean tileAcquired
        Defines whether or not a tile has been acquired in the current phase of the game

      • timer

        private GameTimer timer
        Timer used to dictate the pace and flow of the game This has a visual interface which will be displayed in the top-left corner of the game-screen

      • drawer

        private Drawer drawer
        Object providing QOL drawing functions to simplify visual construction and rendering tasks

      • market

        private Market market
        Holds all of the data and the functions of the game's market Also comes bundled with a visual interface which can be rendered on to the game's screen

      • tiles

        private Tile[] tiles
        Array holding the tiles to be laid over the map Note that the tiles' visuals are encoded by the image declared and stored in the GameScreen class (and not here)

        Variable dictating whether the game is running or paused at any given moment

        An integer signifying the ID of the next roboticon to be created

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine(com.badlogic.gdx.Game game,
                  GameScreen gameScreen)
        Constructs the game's engine. Imports the game's state (for direct renderer access) and the data held by the GameScreen which this engine directly controls; then goes on to set up player-data for the game's players, tile-data for the on-screen map and the in-game market for in-play manipulation. In the cases of the latter two tasks, the engine directly interacts with the GameScreen object imported to it (as a parameter of this constructor) so that it can draw the visual interfaces for the game's market and tiles directly to the game's primary interface.
        Parameters:
        game - Variable storing the game's state
        gameScreen - The object encoding the in-game interface which is to be controlled by this engine

    • Method Detail

      • nextPhase

        public void nextPhase()
        Advances the game's progress upon call Acts as a state machine of sorts, moving the game from one phase to another depending on what phase it is currently at when this method if called. If player 1 is the current player in any particular phase, then the phase number remains and control is handed off to the other player: otherwise, control returns to player 1 and the game advances to the next state, implementing any state-specific features as it goes. PHASE 1: Acquisition of Tiles PHASE 2: Acquisition of Roboticons PHASE 3: Placement of Roboticons PHASE 4: Production of Resources by Roboticons PHASE 5: Market Trading

      • switchCurrentPlayer

        private void switchCurrentPlayer()
        Sets the current player to be that which isn't active whenever this is called Updates the in-game interface to reflect the statistics and the identity of the player now controlling it

      • pauseGame

        public void pauseGame()
        Pauses the game and opens the pause-menu (which is just a sub-stage in the GameScreen class) Specifically pauses the game's timer and marks the engine's internal play-state to [State.PAUSE]

      • resumeGame

        public void resumeGame()
        Resumes the game and re-opens the primary in-game inteface Specifically increments the in-game timer by 1 second, restarts it and marks the engine's internal play-state to [State.PAUSE] Note that the timer is incremented by 1 second to circumvent a bug that causes it to lose 1 second whenever it's restarted

      • claimTile

        public void claimTile()
        Claims the last tile to have been selected on the main GameScreen for the active player This grants them the ability to plant a Roboticon on it and yield resources from it for themselves Specifically registers the selected tile under the object holding the active player's data, re-colours its border for owner identification purposes and moves the game on to the next player/phase

      • deployRoboticon

        public void deployRoboticon()
        Deploys a Roboticon on the last tile to have been selected Draws a Roboticon from the active player's Roboticon count and assigns it to the tile in question

      • state

        public GameEngine.State state()
        Return's the game's current play-state, which can either be [State.RUN] or [State.PAUSE] This is not to be confused with the game-state (which is directly linked to the renderer)
        Returns:
        State The game's current play-state

      • phase

        public int phase()
        Return's the game's phase as a number between (or possibly one of) 1 and 5
        Returns:
        Integer The game's current phase

      • players

        public Player[] players()
        Returns all of the data pertaining to the array of players managed by the game's engine Unless the game's architecture changes radically, this should only ever return two Player objects
        Returns:
        Player[] An array of all Player objects (encapsulating player-data) managed by the engine

      • currentPlayer

        public Player currentPlayer()
        Returns the data pertaining to the player who is active at the time when this is called
        Returns:
        Player The current user's Player object, encoding all of their data

      • currentPlayerID

        public int currentPlayerID()
        Returns the ID of the player who is active at the time when this is called
        Returns:
        Integer The current player's ID

      • timer

        public GameTimer timer()
        Returns the GameTimer declared and managed by the engine
        Returns:
        GameTimer The game's internal timer

      • tiles

        public Tile[] tiles()
        Collectively returns every Tile managed by the engine in array
        Returns:
        Tile[] An array of all Tile objects (encapsulating tile-data) managed by the engine

      • selectedTile

        public Tile selectedTile()
        Returns the data pertaining to the last Tile that was selected by a player
        Returns:
        Tile The last Tile to have been selected

      • market

        public Market market()
        Returns all of the data pertaining to the game's market, which is declared and managed by the engine
        Returns:
        Market The game's market

      • checkGameEnd

        private boolean checkGameEnd()
        Returns a value that's true if all tiles have been claimed, and false otherwise
        Returns:
        Boolean Determines if the game has ended or not

      • updateCurrentPlayer

        public void updateCurrentPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
        Updates the data pertaining to the game's current player This is used by the Market class to process item transactions
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - The new Player object to represent the active player with

      • upgradeRoboticon

        public void upgradeRoboticon(int resource)
        Function for upgrading a particular level of the roboticon stored on the last tile to have been selected
        Parameters:
        resource - The type of resource which the roboticon will gather more of {0: ore | 1: energy | 2: food}
